meanings.definition: Send (goods or services) to another country for sale.
meanings.sent1: The company exported their products to Europe.
meanings.sent2: She exported her handmade crafts to international markets.
meanings.sent3: The little toy car decided to be exported to the toy store for a new adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter exported joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons exported happiness to the children at the party.

meanings.definition: To send or transmit (data) from one program or system to another.
meanings.sent1: The software exported the file to the cloud storage.
meanings.sent2: He exported the photos from his phone to his computer.
meanings.sent3: The email was feeling adventurous and decided to be exported to the spam folder.
meanings.sent4: His words exported a sense of calm to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The signal strength exported the data quickly and efficiently.

meanings.definition: To carry or send (something) to a different place.
meanings.sent1: She exported the package to the post office for delivery.
meanings.sent2: The messenger exported the important documents to the recipient.
meanings.sent3: The wind playfully exported the fallen leaves to the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: His smile exported warmth to everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The river exported debris downstream after the storm.
